texts.label: text
texts.orig: This supplemental information regarding the financial and operating results of Verizon Communications Inc. (Verizon) for the second quarter ended June 30, 2023 contains statements about expected future events and financial results that are forward-looking and subject to risks and uncertainties. Discussion of factors that may affect future results is included at the end of this document and is also contained in Verizon's filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.
texts.text: This supplemental information regarding the financial and operating results of Verizon Communications Inc. (Verizon) for the second quarter ended June 30, 2023 contains statements about expected future events and financial results that are forward-looking and subject to risks and uncertainties. Discussion of factors that may affect future results is included at the end of this document and is also contained in Verizon's filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: ** Total Wireless service revenue represents the sum of Consumer and Business segments.
texts.text: ** Total Wireless service revenue represents the sum of Consumer and Business segments.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consolidated total operating revenue for the second quarter was $32.6 billion, down 3.5% year over year.
texts.text: Consolidated total operating revenue for the second quarter was $32.6 billion, down 3.5% year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Service and other revenue was $27.3 billion, up 0.8% year over year, as the  growth  of  Wireless  service  revenue  was  partially  offset  by  wireline declines and lower Other revenue due to the reallocation of certain fees.
texts.text: Service and other revenue was $27.3 billion, up 0.8% year over year, as the  growth  of  Wireless  service  revenue  was  partially  offset  by  wireline declines and lower Other revenue due to the reallocation of certain fees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Total Wireless service revenue 2 was $19.1 billion, up 3.8% year over year,  driven  primarily  by  pricing  actions  implemented  in  recent quarters, the larger allocation  of  our  administrative  and  telco recovery  fees  from  Other  revenue  into  Wireless  service  revenue,
texts.text: Total Wireless service revenue 2 was $19.1 billion, up 3.8% year over year,  driven  primarily  by  pricing  actions  implemented  in  recent quarters, the larger allocation  of  our  administrative  and  telco recovery  fees  from  Other  revenue  into  Wireless  service  revenue,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: and  growing  contribution  from  our  fixed  wireless  access  (FWA) offerings.
texts.text: and  growing  contribution  from  our  fixed  wireless  access  (FWA) offerings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Total Fios revenue was $3.2 billion, relatively flat year over year as the  benefits  of  Fios  internet  customer  growth  were  more  than offset by declines in voice and video connections.
texts.text: Total Fios revenue was $3.2 billion, relatively flat year over year as the  benefits  of  Fios  internet  customer  growth  were  more  than offset by declines in voice and video connections.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Wireless  equipment  revenue  was  $5.3  billion,  down  20.9%  year  over year, predominantly due to lower upgrade rates.
texts.text: Wireless  equipment  revenue  was  $5.3  billion,  down  20.9%  year  over year, predominantly due to lower upgrade rates.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consolidated net income for the second quarter was $4.8 billion, down 10.3% year over year.
texts.text: Consolidated net income for the second quarter was $4.8 billion, down 10.3% year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consolidated adjusted EBITDA 1 for  the second quarter was $12.0 billion, up 0.8%  year  over  year,  driven  by  Wireless  service  revenue  growth  and  lower upgrade rates.
texts.text: Consolidated adjusted EBITDA 1 for  the second quarter was $12.0 billion, up 0.8%  year  over  year,  driven  by  Wireless  service  revenue  growth  and  lower upgrade rates.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consolidated operating expenses for the second quarter were $25.4 billion, down  3.3%  year  over  year.  Consolidated  operating  expenses,  excluding depreciation  and  amortization  and  special  items, 1 were  $20.6  billion, down 5.9% year over year.
texts.text: Consolidated operating expenses for the second quarter were $25.4 billion, down  3.3%  year  over  year.  Consolidated  operating  expenses,  excluding depreciation  and  amortization  and  special  items, 1 were  $20.6  billion, down 5.9% year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Interest  expense for  the  second  quarter  was  $1.3  billion  compared  to $1.2 billion the  first  quarter  2023  due  to  higher  interest  rates  on  our outstanding debt balance.
texts.text: Interest  expense for  the  second  quarter  was  $1.3  billion  compared  to $1.2 billion the  first  quarter  2023  due  to  higher  interest  rates  on  our outstanding debt balance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Earnings per share (EPS) was $1.10, down 11.3% year over year.
texts.text: Earnings per share (EPS) was $1.10, down 11.3% year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Reported  second  quarter  earnings  reflect  a  pre-tax  loss  from  special items of approximately $598 million. This includes a pre-tax severance charge of $237 million, the impacts of amortization of intangible assets related to TracFone Wireless, Inc. and other acquisitions of $206 million, and  a  pre-tax  asset  rationalization  charge  of  $155  million  related  to certain  real  estate  and  non-strategic  assets  that  we  have  made  a decision to cease use of as part of our transformation initiatives.
texts.text: Reported  second  quarter  earnings  reflect  a  pre-tax  loss  from  special items of approximately $598 million. This includes a pre-tax severance charge of $237 million, the impacts of amortization of intangible assets related to TracFone Wireless, Inc. and other acquisitions of $206 million, and  a  pre-tax  asset  rationalization  charge  of  $155  million  related  to certain  real  estate  and  non-strategic  assets  that  we  have  made  a decision to cease use of as part of our transformation initiatives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Adjusted EPS 1 was $1.21, down 7.6% year over year.
texts.text: Adjusted EPS 1 was $1.21, down 7.6% year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Cash flow from operating activities for the six months ended June 30, 2023 was $18.0 billion compared to $17.7 billion in the prior year period driven by working  capital  improvements  as  a  result  of  lower  receivables  and  lower inventory  levels  tied  to  fewer  upgrades,  which  were  offset  by  higher  cash income taxes and interest expense.
texts.text: Cash flow from operating activities for the six months ended June 30, 2023 was $18.0 billion compared to $17.7 billion in the prior year period driven by working  capital  improvements  as  a  result  of  lower  receivables  and  lower inventory  levels  tied  to  fewer  upgrades,  which  were  offset  by  higher  cash income taxes and interest expense.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Capital  spending  for  the  six  months  ended  June  30,  2023  was  $10.1 billion, including the remaining  $1.75 billion of  the  C-Band  related spending in our guidance.
texts.text: Capital  spending  for  the  six  months  ended  June  30,  2023  was  $10.1 billion, including the remaining  $1.75 billion of  the  C-Band  related spending in our guidance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Our guidance for 2023 capital expenditures of $18.25 billion to $19.25 billion remains unchanged.
texts.text: Our guidance for 2023 capital expenditures of $18.25 billion to $19.25 billion remains unchanged.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Free cash flow 1 for the six months ended June 30, 2023 was $8.0 billion.
texts.text: Free cash flow 1 for the six months ended June 30, 2023 was $8.0 billion.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total unsecured debt as of the end of the second quarter was $131.4 billion, a $0.7 billion  improvement compared to the prior quarter and $1.1 billion lower year over year. Unsecured debt to net income (LTM) ratio was 6.1x as of the end of the second quarter, an increase of 0.1x compared to the prior quarter and a 0.1x improvement year over year.
texts.text: Total unsecured debt as of the end of the second quarter was $131.4 billion, a $0.7 billion  improvement compared to the prior quarter and $1.1 billion lower year over year. Unsecured debt to net income (LTM) ratio was 6.1x as of the end of the second quarter, an increase of 0.1x compared to the prior quarter and a 0.1x improvement year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Net unsecured debt 1 as of the end of the second quarter was $126.6 billion, a $3.2 billion improvement compared to the prior quarter and $4.1 billion lower year over year. Net unsecured debt to adjusted EBITDA ratio 1 was 2.6x as of the end of the second quarter,  a 0.1x improvement both sequentially and year over year.
texts.text: Net unsecured debt 1 as of the end of the second quarter was $126.6 billion, a $3.2 billion improvement compared to the prior quarter and $4.1 billion lower year over year. Net unsecured debt to adjusted EBITDA ratio 1 was 2.6x as of the end of the second quarter,  a 0.1x improvement both sequentially and year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total retail postpaid net additions for the second quarter were 612 thousand, up  from  514  thousand  in  the  prior  year  period,  driven  by  continued  FWA momentum, wearables adoption, and strong Business phone performance.
texts.text: Total retail postpaid net additions for the second quarter were 612 thousand, up  from  514  thousand  in  the  prior  year  period,  driven  by  continued  FWA momentum, wearables adoption, and strong Business phone performance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total postpaid phone net additions for the second quarter were 8 thousand, down from 12 thousand in the prior year period.
texts.text: Total postpaid phone net additions for the second quarter were 8 thousand, down from 12 thousand in the prior year period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Postpaid phone gross additions were 2.3 million, up 2.0% year over year.
texts.text: Postpaid phone gross additions were 2.3 million, up 2.0% year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Postpaid phone churn was 0.83%, up 2 basis points year over year.
texts.text: Postpaid phone churn was 0.83%, up 2 basis points year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Postpaid net additions for the second quarter were 304 thousand, up from 84 thousand  in  the  prior  year  period,  as  growth  in  FWA  and  wearables  was partially offset by phone and tablet losses.
texts.text: Postpaid net additions for the second quarter were 304 thousand, up from 84 thousand  in  the  prior  year  period,  as  growth  in  FWA  and  wearables  was partially offset by phone and tablet losses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Postpaid phone net losses were 136 thousand compared to 215 thousand net losses in the prior year period.
texts.text: Postpaid phone net losses were 136 thousand compared to 215 thousand net losses in the prior year period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Postpaid phone gross additions were 1.6 million, up 6.9% year over year,  continuing  the  momentum that began building in the second half of last year.
texts.text: Postpaid phone gross additions were 1.6 million, up 6.9% year over year,  continuing  the  momentum that began building in the second half of last year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Postpaid phone churn was 0.76%, up 1 basis point year over year.
texts.text: Postpaid phone churn was 0.76%, up 1 basis point year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Prepaid net losses were 304 thousand compared to 229 thousand net losses in the prior year period.
texts.text: Prepaid net losses were 304 thousand compared to 229 thousand net losses in the prior year period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Prepaid churn was 4.24%, up 34 basis points year over year.
texts.text: Prepaid churn was 4.24%, up 34 basis points year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Postpaid  phone  net  additions for  the  second  quarter  were 144  thousand, down from 227 thousand in the prior year period.
texts.text: Postpaid  phone  net  additions for  the  second  quarter  were 144  thousand, down from 227 thousand in the prior year period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Postpaid phone churn was 1.10%, up 3 basis points year over year.
texts.text: Postpaid phone churn was 1.10%, up 3 basis points year over year.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total broadband net additions were 418 thousand for the second quarter, up from 268 thousand in the prior year period, driven by strong demand and good retention rates for both Fios and FWA products.
texts.text: Total broadband net additions were 418 thousand for the second quarter, up from 268 thousand in the prior year period, driven by strong demand and good retention rates for both Fios and FWA products.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · FWA net additions were 384 thousand, up from 256 thousand in the prior year period.
texts.text: FWA net additions were 384 thousand, up from 256 thousand in the prior year period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Consumer FWA net additions were 251 thousand, up 83 thousand year over year.
texts.text: Consumer FWA net additions were 251 thousand, up 83 thousand year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ◦ Business  FWA  net  additions  were  133  thousand,  up  45  thousand year over year.
texts.text: Business  FWA  net  additions  were  133  thousand,  up  45  thousand year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Fios internet net additions were 54 thousand, up from 36 thousand in the prior year period.
texts.text: Fios internet net additions were 54 thousand, up from 36 thousand in the prior year period.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total Consumer revenue for the second quarter was $24.6 billion, down 4.1% year over year, as gains in Service and other revenue were offset by Wireless equipment revenue declines.
texts.text: Total Consumer revenue for the second quarter was $24.6 billion, down 4.1% year over year, as gains in Service and other revenue were offset by Wireless equipment revenue declines.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Consumer Service and other  revenue was  $20.1  billion,  up  1.2%  year over year.
texts.text: Consumer Service and other  revenue was  $20.1  billion,  up  1.2%  year over year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Consumer  Wireless  service  revenue was  $15.8  billion,  up  3.5% year  over  year,  driven  by  Consumer  wireless  postpaid  average revenue per account (ARPA) growth, which was partially offset by decline in retail postpaid phone connections and prepaid connections.
texts.text: Consumer  Wireless  service  revenue was  $15.8  billion,  up  3.5% year  over  year,  driven  by  Consumer  wireless  postpaid  average revenue per account (ARPA) growth, which was partially offset by decline in retail postpaid phone connections and prepaid connections.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Consumer  Fios  revenue was  $2.9  billion,  down  0.3%  year  over year, as the benefits of Fios internet customer growth were more than offset by declines in voice and video connections.
texts.text: Consumer  Fios  revenue was  $2.9  billion,  down  0.3%  year  over year, as the benefits of Fios internet customer growth were more than offset by declines in voice and video connections.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Consumer Wireless equipment revenue was $4.4 billion,  down  22.4% year  over  year,  driven  primarily  by  a  38%  year  over  year  decline  in upgrades.
texts.text: Consumer Wireless equipment revenue was $4.4 billion,  down  22.4% year  over  year,  driven  primarily  by  a  38%  year  over  year  decline  in upgrades.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consumer wireless postpaid ARPA was $131.83 for the second quarter, up 6.2% year over year, driven by  pricing actions implemented in recent quarters, and  the  larger  allocation  of  our  administrative  and  telco  recovery  fees  from Other revenue into Wireless service revenue, as well as an increase in our FWA subscriber base and device protection revenue, partially offset by the amortization impact on service revenue from promotional costs.
texts.text: Consumer wireless postpaid ARPA was $131.83 for the second quarter, up 6.2% year over year, driven by  pricing actions implemented in recent quarters, and  the  larger  allocation  of  our  administrative  and  telco  recovery  fees  from Other revenue into Wireless service revenue, as well as an increase in our FWA subscriber base and device protection revenue, partially offset by the amortization impact on service revenue from promotional costs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consumer  operating  income was  $7.3  billion,  up  2.5%  year  over  year, resulting in operating income margin of 29.8%.
texts.text: Consumer  operating  income was  $7.3  billion,  up  2.5%  year  over  year, resulting in operating income margin of 29.8%.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consumer segment EBITDA 1 was $10.6 billion, up 2.1% year over year. This improvement can be attributed to service revenue growth and lower upgrade volumes.  Consumer  segment  EBITDA  margin 1 for  the  second  quarter  was 43.1%.
texts.text: Consumer segment EBITDA 1 was $10.6 billion, up 2.1% year over year. This improvement can be attributed to service revenue growth and lower upgrade volumes.  Consumer  segment  EBITDA  margin 1 for  the  second  quarter  was 43.1%.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: * Referred to in the first quarter 2023 as "Business Markets and SaaS".
texts.text: Referred to in the first quarter 2023 as "Business Markets and SaaS".

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total Business revenue was $7.5 billion, down 1.9% year over year, as growth in  Wireless  service  revenue  was  more  than  offset  by  lower  Wireline  revenue and lower Wireless equipment revenue.
texts.text: Total Business revenue was $7.5 billion, down 1.9% year over year, as growth in  Wireless  service  revenue  was  more  than  offset  by  lower  Wireline  revenue and lower Wireless equipment revenue.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Business Wireless service revenue was $3.4 billion, up 5.3% year over year,  driven  by  continued  strong  net  additions  and  pricing  actions implemented in recent quarters.
texts.text: Business Wireless service revenue was $3.4 billion, up 5.3% year over year,  driven  by  continued  strong  net  additions  and  pricing  actions implemented in recent quarters.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Business  wireline  results reflect  continued  secular  declines  in  the prevailing wireline market  and  our  rationalization of certain  legacy wireline products, consistent with prior periods.
texts.text: Business  wireline  results reflect  continued  secular  declines  in  the prevailing wireline market  and  our  rationalization of certain  legacy wireline products, consistent with prior periods.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Business  operating  income was  $533  million,  down  21.0%  year  over  year, resulting in operating income margin of 7.1%.
texts.text: Business  operating  income was  $533  million,  down  21.0%  year  over  year, resulting in operating income margin of 7.1%.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Business segment EBITDA 1 was $1.6 billion, down 6.5% year over year, driven by  continued  declines  in  high  margin  Wireline  revenues.  Business  segment EBITDA margin 1 for the second quarter was 21.9%.
texts.text: Business segment EBITDA 1 was $1.6 billion, down 6.5% year over year, driven by  continued  declines  in  high  margin  Wireline  revenues.  Business  segment EBITDA margin 1 for the second quarter was 21.9%.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 1 Non-GAAP  financial  measure.  See  the  accompanying  schedules  and  www.verizon.com/ about/investors for reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures cited in this document to most directly comparable financial measures under generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).

texts.orig: 2 Total Wireless service revenue represents the sum of Consumer and Business segments.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: failure to take advantage of, or respond to competitors' use of, developments in technology and address changes in consumer demand; performance issues or delays in the deployment of our 5G network resulting in significant costs or a  reduction  in  the  anticipated  benefits  of  the  enhancement  to  our  networks; the inability to implement our business strategy; adverse conditions in the U.S. and  international  economies,  including  inflation  in  the  markets  in  which  we operate; cyber attacks impacting our networks or systems and any resulting financial or reputational impact; damage to our infrastructure or disruption of our operations from natural disasters, extreme weather conditions, acts of war, terrorist attacks or other hostile acts and any resulting financial or reputational impact;  the  impact  of  public  health  crises  on  our  operations,  our  employees and the ways in which our customers use our networks and other products and services; disruption of our key suppliers' or vendors' provisioning of products or services, including as a result of geopolitical factors, public health crises or the  potential  impacts  of  global  climate  change;  material  adverse  changes  in labor matters and any resulting financial or operational impact; changes in the regulatory environment  in which we  operate, including any increase in restrictions  on  our  ability  to  operate  our  networks  or  businesses;  allegations regarding the release of hazardous materials or pollutants into the environment from  our,  or  our  predecessors',  network  assets  and  any  related  regulatory developments, litigation, liability, compliance costs, penalties, operational impacts  or  reputational  damage;  our  high  level  of  indebtedness;  significant litigation  and  any  resulting  material  expenses  incurred  in  defending  against lawsuits  or  paying  awards  or  settlements;  an  adverse  change  in  the  ratings afforded our debt securities by nationally accredited ratings organizations or adverse conditions in the credit markets affecting the cost, including interest rates,  and/or  availability  of  further  financing;  significant  increases  in  benefit plan costs or lower investment returns on plan assets; changes in tax laws or treaties, or in their interpretation; and changes in accounting assumptions that regulatory  agencies,  including  the  SEC,  may  require  or  that  result  from changes in the accounting rules or their application, which could result in an impact on earnings.
